answers.answer: Have they checked you for peripheral neuropathy?Are you diabetic?I am diabetic2/ and have this same feeling but in both my tighs.  The doctors (they treat me  in teams) diagnosed: Neuropathy and have given me Cymbalta 60mg a day = Even though this med is for depression, like many other meds, it is also used for neuropathy.A friend is being treated for this similar problem with Neurontin.  This med normally for seizures, but also used for this 'nerve' ending problem.Recommend you research : Neuropathy/Peripheral and Idiopathic (this last one in case you don't have diabetes or any other problem that could have caused it)Good luck......I hope these comments help

Hi, do you have associated low back ache? Please get yourself investigated for that too (MRI spine) as pinched nerve across lower spine give rise to the symptoms you are experiencing.Another possibility is peripheral neuropathy due to vitamin B deficiency. Try vitamin B prepartions at least for a month. In case of no response, do consult Neurologist.

question: I AM A 69 YR OLD FEMALE & ONCE IN AWHILE ALL OF A SUDDEN I GET A NUMBNESS ON MY LEGS & CAN'T STAND UP OR I WILL FALL. THEN A TINGLING FROM TOP OF MY LEGS DOWN TO MY FEET, A WEAKNESS & FEELS COLD INSIDE MY LEGS. HAVE TO SIT AWHILE UNTIL IT GOES AWAY LASTING ABOUT 3 MINUTES. HAVE HAD THIS HAPPENING FOR ABOUT 3 YRS. COULD HIT ME AT ANY TIME NO MATTER WHAT I AM DOING.
title: tingling,numbness on legs down to feet
